name: View
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View
description:
View

A view is a virtual table defined by a SQL query. You can query views in the browser tool, or by using a query job.

BigQuery’s views are logical views, not materialized views, which means that the query that defines the view is re-executed every time the view is queried. Queries are billed according to the total amount of data in all table fields referenced directly or indirectly by the top-level query.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
view = dataset.create_view "my_view",
         "SELECT name, age FROM [proj:dataset.users]"

methods.name: table_id
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#table_id
methods.description: A unique ID for this table. The ID must contain only letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), or underscores (_). The maximum length is 1,024 characters.

methods.name: dataset_id
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#dataset_id
methods.description: The ID of the Dataset containing this table.

methods.name: project_id
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#project_id
methods.description: The ID of the Project containing this table.

methods.name: id
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#id
methods.description: The combined Project ID, Dataset ID, and Table ID for this table, in the format specified by the Query Reference: project_name:datasetId.tableId. To use this value in queries see #query_id.

methods.name: query_id
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#query_id
methods.description: The value returned by #id, wrapped in square brackets if the Project ID contains dashes, as specified by the Query Reference. Useful in queries.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

data = bigquery.query "SELECT name FROM #{table.query_id}"

methods.name: name
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#name
methods.description: The name of the table.

methods.name: name=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#name=
methods.description: Updates the name of the table.

methods.name: etag
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#etag
methods.description: A string hash of the dataset.

methods.name: api_url
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#api_url
methods.description: A URL that can be used to access the dataset using the REST API.

methods.name: description
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#description
methods.description: The description of the table.

methods.name: description=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#description=
methods.description: Updates the description of the table.

methods.name: created_at
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#created_at
methods.description: The time when this table was created.

methods.name: expires_at
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#expires_at
methods.description: The time when this table expires. If not present, the table will persist indefinitely. Expired tables will be deleted and their storage reclaimed.

methods.name: modified_at
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#modified_at
methods.description: The date when this table was last modified.

methods.name: table?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#table?
methods.description: Checks if the table’s type is “TABLE”.

methods.name: view?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#view?
methods.description: Checks if the table’s type is “VIEW”.

methods.name: location
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#location
methods.description: The geographic location where the table should reside. Possible values include EU and US. The default value is US.

methods.name: schema
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#schema
methods.description: The schema of the view.

methods.name: fields
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#fields
methods.description: The fields of the view.

methods.name: headers
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#headers
methods.description: The names of the columns in the view.

methods.name: query
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#query
methods.description: The query that executes each time the view is loaded.

methods.name: query=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#query=
methods.description: Updates the query that executes each time the view is loaded.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
view = dataset.table "my_view"

view.query = "SELECT first_name FROM " \
             "[my_project:my_dataset.my_table]"

params.name: new_query
params.description: The query that defines the view.

methods.name: data
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#data
methods.description: Runs a query to retrieve all data from the view.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
view = dataset.table "my_view"

data = view.data
data.each do |row|
  puts row["first_name"]
end
more_data = data.next if data.next?

params.name: max
params.description:
The maximum number of rows of data to return per
page of results. Setting this flag to a small value such as 1000 and
then paging through results might improve reliability when the query
result set is large. In addition to this limit, responses are also
limited to 10 MB. By default, there is no maximum row count, and
only the byte limit applies.

params.name: timeout
params.description:
How long to wait for the query to complete,
in milliseconds, before the request times out and returns. Note that
this is only a timeout for the request, not the query. If the query
takes longer to run than the timeout value, the call returns without
any results and with QueryData#complete? set to false. The default
value is 10000 milliseconds (10 seconds).

params.name: cache
params.description: Whether to look for the result in the query cache. The query cache is a best-effort cache that will be flushed whenever tables in the query are modified. The default value is true. For more information, see query caching.

params.name: dryrun
params.description: If set to true, BigQuery doesn’t run the job. Instead, if the query is valid, BigQuery returns statistics about the job such as how many bytes would be processed. If the query is invalid, an error returns. The default value is false.

methods.name: delete
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#delete
methods.description: Permanently deletes the table.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
bigquery = gcloud.bigquery
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

table.delete

returns.description: Returns true if the table was deleted.

methods.name: reload!
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
View#reload!
methods.description: Reloads the table with current data from the BigQuery service.
